channel.title: Thingiverse - Newest Things
channel.description: The newest and coolest things from Thingiverse.com

item.title: Bosch MUM4 disc axle
item.description:
This is the Bosch MuM4 series mixer/food processor's disc axle part. You need to have the original hexagonal shaft to assembly it.

I've created two versions as follows:

v1 is as close to the original as possible. Drawback is the brittle upper sticks (prone to break off from the original axle too)

v2 is without the upper sticks and the hexagonal shaft will get fixed to the disc axle with 5mm high hexagonal hole in the middle (this doesn't exist in the original Bosch part). When installing the hexa shaft, you need to push it in the middle hole until the first section of the shaft goes through the hexagonal hole, then turn the shaft 90degree and continue pushing into the final position. (The hexagonal shaft has 3 separated sections and the middle one is differs with 90deg.)
item.author: shakebocaj

item.title: Sennheiser hd205 ear pad mount
item.description: Ear pads mount for Sennheiser hd205
item.author: VanG-0-

item.title: Doodboard Duckboard Middle Layer
item.description:
This middle layers prevent excessive dust and dirt to accumulate inside the board and help diffuse the LEDs. Just replace entirely the 3D printed standoffs and fix them directly with the screws (may need to drill a little the holes).

Above - (Green) Between switch plate and PCB. Prevent dirt accumulation.
Below - (Yellow) Between PCB and Bottom plate, 1mm and 2mm variants (thickness of the perimeter walls). Dirt and LED diffusion.
item.author: RmAouad

item.title: Mini FLSUN SR Super Racer Model
item.description:
I made a mini Sidewinder X1 and wanted a mini FLsun SR. I actually made this on the Q5 so I could measure on the SR while printing the prototype.

The struts should snap onto the effector plate and the carriers. Print a carrier and a strut first at .06 or .1 layer height to see if they snap together. if not scale the strut to fit. Print 3 Carriers and 6 struts then snap them together

Then print the Effector plate at .06 or .1 layer height but scale same as carriers. Snap struts onto it. If that works, print the top, bottom, 3 legs and the rest of the parts at .15 layer height. I didn't use supports on anything

I used TPU as the PTFE tube and coiled some TPU on a real PTFE tube then heated with a heat gun to get it to coil up.

Glue it together solid if you like.

I added Fusion 360 files so you genius cad people can make improvements. Please share if you do. I had fun. Hope you do too.

I printed Phil-A-Ment at 20% scale

item.title: Logitech webcam adapter for Ender3v2 arm - remix
item.description:
Hi I'm new to this.

All the credit goes to the orginal creators of course:
This a remix of https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:5178622
Which looked great but didn't fit my model.
This is made to fit Logitech c525 with a 61cm base
I included the adapter made by StuTravers(I think?)
Also includes the Ultimate Sturdy Octoprint arm made by Stewpercharged
https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3374914
So it's an all in one download..

Not sure if I'm allowed to add their models to my remix, but again, all the credit goes to the original owners, I just extended the model a bit.

15% Infill with PLA and 2-3 walls is plenty.
item.author: cupcakepwr

item.title: Bird Prosthesis (Mutum)
item.description: This prosthesis was created especially for a curassow, a large bird, which strictly inhabits the forests of southeastern Brazil.
item.author: PauloAlba

item.title: Turtle Duck (ATLA)
item.description:
This model was made by one of my friends for some 3D renders in blender. He showed it to me and I asked if it would be possible for me to edit the model to make it 3D printer friendly, and he kindly said yes! Feel free to print smaller or bigger, though the smaller versions become harder with adhesion because of the small feets.

This model can be sold when printed, but the file or remixes of it shall not be sold without permission first. Please be responsible with printing <3

Thanks again to Husam Staubmann, the friend that made the original model I edited here!

Here is his artstation, make sure to give him some support! https://www.artstation.com/artwork/3dOWQA
item.author: Sytan

item.title: Remington Express Picatinny Rail Rear Sight Replacement
item.description:
Picatinny rail replacement for the Remington Express air rifle's rear sight. Uses the existing holes in the receiver that the sight originally mounted with.

You should be able to reuse the original sight screws (though you'll still need one), and one more (M3x7 - M3x10). It's worth noting that the original M3 screwheads are a bit weak and might strip if you aren't careful.

One problem with break barrel air rifles (and other break actions in general) is that the barrel will always lock in a slightly different position. As such, the point of impact may be different between each projectile fired when using a scope mounted on the receiver. This isn't a big problem on every break barrel airgun, but I found the variance shooting the Remington Express could be quite annoying. With something like a zero parallax reflex sight or airgun rated pistol scope, it could be useful.

item.title: 1/4" Bar Perpendicular PPC (Pixel Pipe Clip) for 12mm Bullet Pixels
item.description:
This is a PPC (Pixel Pipe Clip) that will securely hold a 12mm Bullet pixel perpendicular to a bar for Christmas Lights. This was designed for 1/4" round bar. There is also a locking pin option that will help keep the clip centered on the pipe. A 3mm drill bit is recommended when using the locking pin version. The locking pin is 3mm in diameter and 1mm thick.

Other designs are available and are listed below.

PVC Schedule 40 Version:
Perpendicular PPC to 1/2in PVC Pipe
Perpendicular PPC to 3/4in PVC Pipe
Perpendicular PPC to 1in PVC Pipe

EMT Version:
Perpendicular PPC to 1/2in EMT Pipe
Perpendicular PPC to 3/4in EMT Pipe

Round Bar Version:
Perpendicular PPC to 1/4in Bar

Metric PVC Version:
Perpendicular PPC to 20mm PVC Pipe
Perpendicular PPC to 25mm PVC Pipe

Want to make sure you have these PPCs spaced out accurately? Check out the spacers I created by following the links below (only locking pin version supported at this time):

PVC Schedule 40 Version:
PPC Locking Pin Spacer Tool for 1/2in PVC Pipe
PPC Locking Pin Spacer Tool for 3/4in PVC Pipe
PPC Locking Pin Spacer Tool for 1in PVC Pipe

EMT Version:
PPC Locking Pin Spacer Tool for 1/2in EMT Pipe
PPC Locking Pin Spacer Tool for 3/4in EMT Pipe

Metric PVC Version:
PPC Locking Pin Spacer Tool for 20mm PVC Pipe
PPC Locking Pin Spacer Tool for 25mm PVC Pipe

Have a suggestion for a mounting clip? Don't be afraid to contact us on our Facebook page, or send us a message here!

www.facebook.com/siskfamilylightshows

Like my designs? Help support us by donating to our show!

Thanks for looking at and supporting my designs!

item.author: PHOENlX

item.title: Varjo Aero - Sennheiser HD25 Adapter
item.description:
This is a remix/mashup of several existing designs I found and modified to my needs. The clips fit on the Aero band nice and snug if you put them on where the band narrows just behind the tilt adjustment knobs and slide the clips back.

Requires 2-each of:
M3x25 hex bolt (or a cut down 30mm like I used)
M3 nylon lock nut
M3 washer

Printed in PLA

5 files plus a Prusa slicer 3MF project.

Print 2 each of the inner and outer knobs as well as the arms. 1 each of the left and right clips

I printed the arms as they are in the STL file with supports
item.author: mjfmaker1

item.title: Flashlight mount for Mossberg 500
item.description: Used two black 4-40 screws about 7mm in length. Nuts were about 3 mm in thickness. The closed hole on the top end is to fit over the magazine. Fits pretty snug. I had supports turned on for the nut and screw holes.
item.author: JustinMcDustin

item.title: cargo crane
item.description:
finally created this cargo crane for my land train, it is not really meant to work, more glue it in the position you like but I have provided some sections for holes, either put a pin in it or use as a guide to drill holes to add larger magnets.

01 is the base section such as rails, and car
02 is the various arms
03 is the grabber section.

I printed this on a ender 3 pro at 0.28 some parts will need rafts and others will need supports,
When printing FDM the grabber body can be a bit funny about supporting the middle but I got it working by playing with the settings.

plan to make other grabber ends and also wall mounting but all good things with time
item.author: bda56

item.title: Rancher rear bumper for metal hitch
item.description: modified rear bumper for metal hitch for Rancher model 3Dsets
item.author: sova007

item.title: Diy Thumb Joystick Rocker Gimbals
item.description:
English:

I desinged this thumb joystick for a flight RC controller i'm making.
It's designed arround the potenciometer RV09 5kohm 1/4 turn. Only 2 potenciometers and a 2mm rod is needed as axle between the Y axis roller and the suport. The X axis is suported by the potenciometer.
The Y axis suports are glued to the back using cyanoacrylate.
The stick can be bolted to de X roller using 1/8' o M3 bolts or just glue.

Español:

Diseñe este joystick para un controlador RC de vuelo que estoy haciendo.
Esta diseñado para usar el potenciómetro RV09 5kohm de 1/4 de vuelta.
Solo se necesitan 2 potenciómetros y una varilla de 2mm que hace de eje entre tambor del eje Y y el soporte. El eje X rota sobre el eje del potenciómetro.
Los soportes del eje Y se pegan a la parte del atrás usando cianoacrilato.
El mango se atornilla al tambor del eje X con un tornillo de 1/8 o M3 o se puede pegar.
item.author: magontek

item.title: Geprc Mark4 kinframes 0-60° GoPro base
item.description:
Base plate made for Geprc mark 4 drone.
0 - 60deg Adjustable in 5deg increments
